heading: ux research study
description: By employing the guerilla design tactics I learned from the Udacity UX Design Course, I quickly managed to plan and conduct this research study for an online whisky shop project in only a few days.

heading: balsamiq
description: I find Balsamiq really easy to use. It is a brilliant tool to quickly create mockups for a design. These were made for my first static website frontend development project in the bootcamp at Code Institute.

heading: figma
description:
In parallel to my frontend studies, I have also taken the time to get proficient in Figma. I have learned how to make use of Figma's most powerful features, like the auto layout, create components or make prototypes, and I keep learning new features and shortcuts each time I use it. 

 These are the wireframes for this portfolio. The website itself and my GitHub pages demonstrate the skills in HTML, SCSS and JavaScript I have picked up from the two bootcamps.

heading: paradox
description:
The little girl standing in the archway and the woman to the right in the background are the same person.

With Object Selection and the Lasso tool, I have isolated the background in the picture with the little girl, putting extra effort into the details in the iron gate. I then replaced the background with the picture of the two women to create the illusion of a paradox.
